Sweetwaters still not providing water to Kaitāia despite $13.5m spent so far https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/sweetwaters-still-not-providing-water-to-kaitaia-despite-135m-spent-so-far/ZIR4PYMFK5GSLBATMPRJOVGN74/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/sweetwaters-still-not-providing-water-to-kaitaia-despite-135m-spent-so-far/ZIR4PYMFK5GSLBATMPRJOVGN74/ Mike DinsdaleKaitāia's Sweetwaters project still not producing clear water. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 02:00:00 +0000 Emergency water tanks have been used in Kaitāia during previous droughts that have left the town’s water supply low.
Public sector cuts: Customs and the Department of Internal Affairs propose further job losses https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/public-sector-cuts-customs-begins-consultation-with-staff-on-further-cuts/TDHHUY7J2VEQ3MOTOEDYHPO6JQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/public-sector-cuts-customs-begins-consultation-with-staff-on-further-cuts/TDHHUY7J2VEQ3MOTOEDYHPO6JQ/ Azaria HowellThe PSA says jobs would be cut from airports and counter terrorism teams. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 02:00:00 +0000 The New Zealand Customs Service has been asked to find cost savings of 6.5 per cent. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Northland policewoman farewelled with guard of honour https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/northland-police-woman-farewelled-with-guard-of-honour/NJDM5DEH55CWXEXP6HNDMV4HYE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/northland-police-woman-farewelled-with-guard-of-honour/NJDM5DEH55CWXEXP6HNDMV4HYE/ Avneesh VincentSome officers seemed visibly emotional with several taking a moment to wipe their tears. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 01:57:04 +0000 Police create a guard of honour in memory of Gail Shepherd. Photo/ Michael Cunningham
Hastings’ Common Room bar closes outdoor stage after noise complaint from new hotel nearby https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/hastings-common-room-bar-closes-outdoor-stage-after-noise-complaint-from-new-hotel-nearby/ECKNCZ4MJND5VCIXUJXJ4JFCJM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/hastings-common-room-bar-closes-outdoor-stage-after-noise-complaint-from-new-hotel-nearby/ECKNCZ4MJND5VCIXUJXJ4JFCJM/ James PocockThe hotel doesn't want the stage to be shut, but the bar owner says he has no choice now. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 01:49:42 +0000 Common Room owner Gerard Barron announced he was taking down the live music venue's outdoor stage due to Council imposed noise restrictions following a noise complaint. Photo / Warren Buckland
Horse and rider challenged by new sensory trial at Levin Riding for the Disabled https://www.nzherald.co.nz/horowhenua-chronicle/news/horse-and-rider-challenged-by-new-sensory-trial-at-levin-riding-for-the-disabled/JKESPSFDRVB6FOV5M3HOI5TICU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/horowhenua-chronicle/news/horse-and-rider-challenged-by-new-sensory-trial-at-levin-riding-for-the-disabled/JKESPSFDRVB6FOV5M3HOI5TICU/ Paul WilliamsThe new sensory trail at Levin RDA presents new challenges for riders and their mounts. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 01:44:27 +0000 Levin Riding for the Disabled volunteer Carolyn Cordery with the abacus on the new sensory trail at the Mako Mako Rd complex.
Auckland police investigate if two Newmarket Partridge Jewellers ram raids connected https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-police-investigate-if-two-newmarket-partridge-jewellers-ram-raids-connected/G6N7SQKHIZGI3LRYVDKS4ARXJU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-police-investigate-if-two-newmarket-partridge-jewellers-ram-raids-connected/G6N7SQKHIZGI3LRYVDKS4ARXJU/ The vehicle used in last night's raid was found abandoned a short distance from the store. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 01:29:57 +0000 Glass could be seen across the floor of Partridge Jewellers in Newmarket Mall after being ram-raided twice in just over a week.
PM Christopher Luxon and Nicole McKee to announce justice changes, Government brings back Three Strikes law https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/watch-live-government-to-announce-justice-changes/EVNFQ354KJC5DA46R2YS2523JM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/watch-live-government-to-announce-justice-changes/EVNFQ354KJC5DA46R2YS2523JM/ Reinstating Three Strikes was a policy campaigned on at the election. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 01:15:58 +0000 Prime Minister Christopher Luxon and Associate Justice Minister Nicole McKee have unveiled a revised Three Strikes law, which was abolished under the Labour Government. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Napier florist beauKayes celebrates 10 years in business https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/napier-courier/napier-florist-beaukayes-celebrates-10-years-in-business/6KSVX4YFSNDSROGBL5NRXUQFTI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/napier-courier/napier-florist-beaukayes-celebrates-10-years-in-business/6KSVX4YFSNDSROGBL5NRXUQFTI/ Maddisyn JeffaresThe owner of Napier florist beauKayes loves to make someone's day with flowers. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 01:08:44 +0000 Kaye van Booma, owner of beauKayes florist in Taradale celebrating 10 years of owning her own shop. Photo / Paul Taylor
Woolworths roll out body cameras for supermarket staff as assaults, abuse skyrockets https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/45m-security-spend-woolworths-roll-out-body-cameras-for-staff-as-assaults-abuse-skyrockets/5SIOOXDFP5GC3JAWPHDKXEL3BA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/45m-security-spend-woolworths-roll-out-body-cameras-for-staff-as-assaults-abuse-skyrockets/5SIOOXDFP5GC3JAWPHDKXEL3BA/ The rollout is part of Woolworths’ three year, $45 million programme to add more security. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 00:43:47 +0000 Woolworths is introducing team safety cameras in its 191 stores this week, following positive feedback from a trial in 17 supermarkets. Photo / Supplied
Taranaki’s smallest council holds meeting 60km away from council chambers https://www.nzherald.co.nz/stratford-press/news/taranakis-smallest-council-holds-meeting-60km-away-from-council-chambers/A4BOCXXFGJDWNP3IF27G5U4QII/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/stratford-press/news/taranakis-smallest-council-holds-meeting-60km-away-from-council-chambers/A4BOCXXFGJDWNP3IF27G5U4QII/ Ilona HanneIt's a tradition that mayor Neil Volzke says is a highlight in his meeting calendar. Mon, 22 Apr 2024 00:09:54 +0000 Once a year, Stratford District Council holds a council meeting in Whangamomona, about 60km east of the council's main office in Stratford. Photo / Ilona Hanne
